title: Miss Nicaragua is Miss Universe 2023 â€” see the pics
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands The 72nd Miss Universe has officially been crowned. On Saturday, Nov. 18, Miss Nicaragua Sheynnis Palacios was crowned the winner of the competition by Miss USA Râ€™Bonney Gabriel,    Palacios was among the 84 women to compete for the title Miss Universe this year in San Salvador, El Salvador.  Miss Universe shared a video of Palaciosâ€™ reaction to her crowning achievement on  , formerly known as Twitter, including the moment her name was announced as the winner.Â  In the clip, Palacios looked shocked at first before she began to tear up on stage. As the booming applause and cheers continued, her hands began to shake as she covered her face before the big moment. Eventually, the Miss Universe sash was draped around Palaciosâ€™ body before she was handed a bouquet of purple flowers. To complete the moment, a massive tiara was placed on her head while the crowd continued to go wild. Miss Thailand Anntonia Porsild was named 1st runner-up, with 2nd runner-up going to Miss Australia Moraya Wilson. Miss Puerto Rico Karla GuilfÃº and Miss Colombia Camila Avella completed the top five of the Miss Universe 2023 competition. Meanwhile, Miss Spain, Athenea PÃ©rez,Â won this yearâ€™s Miss Congeniality title. Palacios, who hails from Managua, Nicaragua, is an audiovisual producer and health activist, according to   She was able to support herself through her college Communications program by working at her momâ€™s snack business. When her mom moved up north to find a better job amid economic crisis, she became the support â€” both economical and emotional â€” for her grandma and younger brother.  Inspired by her own struggles with anxiety, Palacios will be focusing on mental health as her cause, even starting the initiative â€œUnderstand Your Mindâ€ where she interviews specialists on emotional care on TV. In the hours leading up to final moments of competition, Palacios reflected on her journey in a post on   written in Spanish.Â  She said that she would be dedicating the night to her â€œinner girlâ€ and the other girls who strive to dream as big as Miss Universe, encouraging them to follow their ambitions. Palacios also thanked her homeland, Nicaragua, for their support and for being able to be an â€œambassador of your culture.â€Â  The 2023 Miss Universe competition was slated to become the most inclusive yet, per  .Â  Miss Guatemala Michelle Cohn and Miss Colombia Camila Avella are both mothers, which was previously against the rules of the competition. Rikkie Valerie KollÃ© made history in July when she   and is now the second openly transgender Miss Universe contestant    Miss Portugal Marina Machete also became the first transgender contestant in her country to   back in October. Francesca Gariano is a New York City-based freelance journalist reporting on culture, entertainment, beauty, lifestyle and wellness. She is a freelance contributor to TODAY.com,Â where she covers pop culture and breaking news. Â©Â 2023 NBC UNIVERSAL

title: Jason Momoa canâ€™t stop thinking about the Roman Empire in hilarious â€˜SNLâ€™ sketch
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands The Roman Empire remains top-of-mind for men across the world, including those on â€œSaturday Night Live.â€ Jason Momoa   for the second time on Saturday, Nov. 18 alongside   The episode featured a digital short that talked about mensâ€™ favorite internet topic of 2023 â€”    Back in September, posts that contained the hashtag #romanempire garnered millions of views across TikTok, with women asking the men in their life how often they thought of the Roman Empire. Spoiler alert: a lot, apparently. Even travel writer and television personality Rick Steves told TODAY.com in October that  , though that was more likely due to his job than anything else. In the  , Jason Momoa, Mikey Day, and Kenan Thompsonâ€™s partners Ego Nwodim, Chloe Troast, and Punkie Johnson all question what is on their minds.Â  Nwodim gets more than she bargains for when she inquires about Momoaâ€™s feelings and he reveals that it was the Roman Empire and not their relationship. â€œIâ€™m just thinking about the Roman Empire, Ancient Rome, five times a day it pops into my dome, which reminds me, they invented the dome,â€ he raps in full ancient gladiator garb. â€œItâ€™s one of the reasons that I think about Rome. Caesar, straight didnâ€™t give a f---, drank ice cold water from an aqueduct.â€ In a hard transition from the Roman Empire rap to Troast delicately singing about her newborn baby, Troast starts to assume that her partner, Day, is tearing up thinking about their child. He was not.Â  â€œRome, Rome, bring a tear to my eye in the year MMXXIII,â€ Day raps, before spitting off random facts about Rome. â€œDid you know that their statues werenâ€™t white? They painted them in colors bold and bright!â€ Johnson barely got a chance to reflect on the financial struggles in her relationship with Thompson before the sketch cut to a clip of the comedian rapping about the Roman Empire.Â  â€œGladiators would rarely ever die, itâ€™s not like the movies, they mostly stayed alive,â€ Thompson says. â€œThey built roads so good, theyâ€™re still in use today.â€ To snap Momoa out of his Roman Empire trance, Nwodim smacks him across the face twice and begins to scold him for constantly thinking about the ancient empire, which she says is rubbing off on their son. As it turns out, their son's personal fixation isnâ€™t the Roman Empire, but rather, dinosaurs. When Momoa falls back into his trance, Nwodim smacks him once again, telling him he needs to â€œbe thinking about things that matter today.â€  And whatâ€™s that, one may ask? Astrology.Â  At the end of the sketch, Momoa makes the mistake of pointing out that the Romans were also interested in astrology, which earns him another smack from Nwodim across the face. Francesca Gariano is a New York City-based freelance journalist reporting on culture, entertainment, beauty, lifestyle and wellness. She is a freelance contributor to TODAY.com,Â where she covers pop culture and breaking news. Â©Â 2023 NBC UNIVERSAL

title: Disney, Apple among advertisers to pull business on X after Elon Muskâ€™s antisemitic post
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands Tech billionaire Elon Musk faced a third day of backlash Friday from Jewish leaders,Â  Â and media advertisers including Disney and Apple after he embraced an antisemitic conspiracy theory earlier in the week, the latest in a pattern of his echoing anti-Jewish bigotry going back years.Â  Musk sparked the criticism with six words he posted Wednesday afternoon on X, the social media app he purchased a year ago. Responding to another user who had accused Jews of hating white people and who had expressed indifference to antisemitism, Musk wrote: â€œYou have said the actual truth.â€Â  Musk, the CEO of the automaker Tesla and the rocket company SpaceX, followed up his first tweet with criticism of the Anti-Defamation League, or ADL, an organization founded by Jews to oppose antisemitism.Â  Â for months over its efforts to reduce extremism on social media, a campaign that Musk says has cost X ad sales.Â  On Thursday morning, Jonathan Greenblatt, the ADLâ€™s CEO, said Musk was acting dangerously.Â  â€œAt a time when antisemitism is exploding in America and surging around the world, it is indisputably dangerous to use oneâ€™s influence to validate and promote antisemitic theories,â€ heÂ  , with a screenshot of Muskâ€™s six-word tweet.Â  The White HouseÂ  Â as the backlash continued, saying that Musk had promoted â€œantisemitic and racist hateâ€ against â€œour core values as Americans.â€ Accounts with histories of espousing anti-Jewish views celebrated Muskâ€™s tweet as welcome news and as confirmation that he agrees with them â€œon the JQ,â€ short for â€œJewish question,â€ a termÂ  Â for decades.Â  â€œThis is old-timey antisemitism with new lingo,â€ said A.J. Bauer, an assistant professor of journalism who studies right-wing movements and media at the University of Alabama. Musk announced a content policy Friday that the ADL welcomed, saying that X would suspend accounts that use the phrase â€œfrom the river to the sea.â€ The phrase is popular among many Palestinians, while many Jews say the phrase meansÂ  . But otherwise, Musk was defiant about his comments earlier in the week. His tweets from Wednesday were still online, and Friday, he posted on X that free speech was at stake and that he would not be pressured. â€œI am sticking to my principles!â€ he replied to one user.Â  â€œAs for any fake advocacy groups who seek to suppress free speech, they should remember that karma is real,â€ he added.Â  A representative for X did not immediately respond to an interview request Friday.Â  IBM said Thursday it had pulled its advertisements from X. A recent investigation by the progressive organization Media Matters found thatÂ  Â were running on X adjacent to pro-Nazi material.Â  â€œIBM has zero tolerance for hate speech and discrimination and we have immediately suspended all advertising on X while we investigate this entirely unacceptable situation,â€ the company said in a statement. A representative for IBM added that the company was investigating the Media Matters report, not Muskâ€™s posts specifically.Â  The Walt Disney Company is also pausing spending on X, according to a source with direct knowledge. Its decision was earlierÂ  Â by The New York Times. Two other media companies, Paramount Global and Warner Bros. Discovery, said through representatives late Friday that they were pausing, too. Comcast and NBCUniversal are also holding off on advertising on the X platform, a spokesperson said Friday. (Comcast owns NBCUniversal, which is the parent company of NBC News.) Apple is also holding off on advertising on X, a person familiar with the matter told CNBC. The European Commission decided toÂ  Â over concerns about disinformation, Politico reported Friday. A commission spokesperson did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the report. Linda Yaccarino, the CEO of X, said on the platform Thursday that antisemitism and discrimination are unacceptable, though she did not directly address Muskâ€™s tweets or IBMâ€™s move. â€œWhen it comes to this platform â€” X has also been extremely clear about our efforts to combat antisemitism and discrimination. Thereâ€™s no place for it anywhere in the world â€” itâ€™s ugly and wrong. Full stop,â€Â  . X also said in an email that Media Mattersâ€™ investigation was flawed, in part because ads are designed to follow people as they browse the site, so the researcher saw the same ads multiple times in ways others might not.Â  Musk defended his past tweets inÂ  , saying he is a â€œprosemite,â€ not an antisemite.Â Â  Muskâ€™s latest comments came at a fraught time for Jews worldwide and in Israel. Reports of antisemitic incidents in the U.S. climbed 388% in the aftermath of Hamasâ€™ terrorist attacks last month compared to the same period last year, according to the ADL. This week, the Biden administrationÂ  Â to reduce antisemitism and Islamophobia.Â  Rabbi Abraham Cooper, the director of global social action for the Simon Wiesenthal Center, an organization named for the famed Nazi hunter, said he was baffled by the way Musk uses X.Â  â€œI donâ€™t understand why Elon Musk, even though itâ€™s his toy, would jump in with this kind of statement, whatever his motivation may be, that further involves him with bigots,â€ he said.Â  â€œI almost feel like saying to him, â€˜Grow up,â€™â€ he added.Â  Experts who study antisemitism and other extremism said Musk was parroting decades-old baseless claims about Jewsâ€™ colluding with one another at the expense of others.Â  â€œNot only is there no evidence; these have been discredited time and time again,â€ said Matthew Hughey, a sociology professor at the University of Connecticut who has studied white supremacy.Â  Musk has 163 million followers on X, more than anyone else, so what he publishes can have a real impact on the real-world actions of others, Hughey added.Â  â€œWe should expect to see more hate crimes and rallying around this type of discourse because of his amplification,â€ he said.Â  Muskâ€™s tweet was the third post in a thread involving other people. The initial post, by a self-described Jewish conservative from South Florida, was a video condemning antisemitism online. It said: â€œYou got something you want to say? Why dont you say it to our faces.â€ The second person then jumped in with a multi-paragraph outline of a conspiracy theory sometimes known as the â€œ ,â€ which has been amplified by former Fox News host Tucker Carlson, among others. This person said that Jewish communities have been pushing â€œhatred against whitesâ€ and that Jews support â€œfloodingâ€ the U.S. with â€œhordes of minorities.â€Â  The person wrote that he was â€œdeeply disinterestedâ€ in â€œwestern Jewish populationsâ€ who are now facing threats, to which Musk responded, â€œYou have said the actual truth.â€Â  By Friday, Muskâ€™s tweet had received 6.7 million views on X, according to the siteâ€™s view counter.Â  Musk has a long history of amplifying antisemitic conspiracy theories. In 2018,Â  : â€œWho do you think *owns* the press? Helloâ€; in aÂ  Â in response to accusations of antisemitism at the time, he said he was referring only to â€œpowerful people.â€ Last year, he tweeted a photo of Adolf Hitler asÂ  Â andÂ  , formerly known as Kanye West, to social media despite Yeâ€™s antisemitic comments.Â  â€œElon Musk has been making antisemitic comments on Twitter and on other formats for many, many years,â€ said Bauer, of the University of Alabama.Â  â€œWhen someone tells you who they are, you should listen, and heâ€™s long been telling us that heâ€™s an antisemite,â€ he said. David Ingram covers tech for NBC News. Â©Â 2023 NBC UNIVERSAL

title: Taylor Swiftâ€™s music temporarily banned from Philadelphia radio station ahead of Eagles-Chiefs game
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands Taylor Swift fans in southeast Pennsylvania wonâ€™t be able to get their fix of the singerâ€™s music until after the next Philadelphia Eagles game. Amid Swiftâ€™s rumored  , Q102, a radio station in Philadelphia, is taking a stand.  Q102 announced that Swiftâ€™s music will be temporarily banned from the station starting Friday, Nov. 17 leading up to the matchup between the Kansas City Chiefs and Philadelphia Eagles on Nov. 20 at Arrowhead Stadium. , an affiliate in Philadelphia, shared a news release from Buster Satterfield, an on-air personality and the program director for the station, on Nov. 16.Â  â€œThe Eagle/ Chiefs Game is Monday night, and we need the Birds to focus,â€ Satterfield said. â€œQ102 Loves Taylor Swift as much as the rest of the world but this weekend, the only Swift and Kelce we recognize play for the Birds.â€ Though Swift   â€” and even name dropped the team in her song â€œGold Rushâ€ â€” sheâ€™s been spotted on multiple occasions   at Chiefs games in recent months.Â  Swiftâ€™s wavering allegiance to the Eagles,  , has become a topic of conversation for several Eagles players,  Hurts told TODAY.com on the Time100 Next red carpet that â€œitâ€™s nothing personalâ€ when it comes to Swiftâ€™s support of the Chiefs, adding, â€œIâ€™m just focused on winning games. Nothing else really matters.â€ Jason Kelce, Travis Kelce's older brother and center for the Eagles, has even poked fun at Swiftâ€™s shift of support, including a moment with her own father.Â  On the Nov. 15 episode of the brothersâ€™ podcast   Jason and Travis Kelce recalled a moment at the singer's concert on Nov. 11 where the her father, Scott Swift,  after   to sing â€œKarma is the guy on the Chiefs/ Coming straight home to me.â€ Jason Kelce pointed out that Swiftâ€™s dad was wearing a Kansas City Chiefs lanyard at the show, to which Travis Kelce responded, â€œGot him over here to the good side, babyâ€¦One by one, just getting all the good ones.â€ â€œScott, what are we doing, Scott?â€ Jason Kelce said. â€œYouâ€™re gonna let this manâ€™s devilishly good looks and relationship with your daughter sway you from a lifetime of fandom, Scott?â€ After Travis Kelce   to watch Swift perform in Buenos Aires,   to travel back to the United States for the matchup between the Chiefs and the Eagles. However, Swift decided to   due to "extreme temperatures" and reschedule the concert to Monday, Nov. 20 â€” the same night as the long-awaited game. Francesca Gariano is a New York City-based freelance journalist reporting on culture, entertainment, beauty, lifestyle and wellness. She is a freelance contributor to TODAY.com,Â where she covers pop culture and breaking news. Â©Â 2023 NBC UNIVERSAL

title: Gwyneth Paltrow explains why she 'stepped away' from acting after daughter Apple was born
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands Gwyneth Paltrow is sharing why she decided to take a break from acting after welcoming her first child, daughter Apple Martin, 19 years ago.  The Academy Award-winning actor has spoken frequently over the years about why she rarely takes acting roles, and now she's opening up about the exact moment she started to devote less time to her acting career.  In 2004, Paltrow and her ex-husband, Coldplay frontman Chris Martin, became parents for the first time when Apple Martin was born. The former couple's son, Moses Martin, arrived in 2006.  The 51-year-old Goop founder spoke to   about her children in a recent interview and revealed that motherhood is one of the reasons why she has taken a step back from the big screen.  When speaking about her   over the last decade, Paltrow said, "Well, itâ€™s kind of ironic because I really stepped away from acting when Apple was born. The last time I was in every scene of a movie was when I was pregnant with her." She said she started to think about the lengthy filming schedule that some movies require and knew she couldn't spend that much time away from her children.  "When I had (Apple), it just, everything felt redefined for me, and I thought, â€˜Iâ€™m not sure that I want to do this so much as a career. I definitely donâ€™t want to...Iâ€™m not going to go away for months on end,'" she said.  The "Shakespeare in Love" star told   that she preferred being away from the spotlight and at home with her children.  "I feel very blessed that Iâ€™ve been able to try to pursue this other career and kind of like keep hours where Iâ€™m able to be home and make them dinner and stuff like that," she shared at the time.  In addition to her two children with Chris Martin, Paltrow is also a stepmother to husband Brad Falchuk's two children: Isabella and Brody Falchuk. During an Instagram Q&A August 30, the businesswoman said she cares for her stepchildren as if they are her kids.  â€œYou know,Â thereâ€™s no book on this; nobody tells us what to do. And in fact, all of the existing media around what a stepmother is casts us in this evil, villainous light," she said, according to  .  She added, "But for myself, the minute I decided, and fully embodied the idea that my step kids were my kids and I love them just as much and I gave them the same rules and boundaries, and just kind of whole-heartedly went for it, then the easier the whole thing got. And now itâ€™s pretty great."  Read on to learn more about Paltrowâ€™s children. In 2004, Paltrow welcomed her daughter, Apple, with Martin.  In an   at the time, Paltrow revealed why she named her daughter Apple.  "When we were first pregnant, her daddy said, â€˜If itâ€™s a girl I think her name should be Apple.' It sounded so sweet, and it conjured such a lovely picture for me, you know," Paltrow said. "Apples are so sweet and theyâ€™re wholesome, and itâ€™s biblical. And I just thought it sounded so lovely." Paltrow noted that Martin was "so in love" with Apple after she arrived. They immediately noticed that their daughter was a "very tranquil" and "aware" baby. "The first morning we woke up together in the hospital bed, and we were facing each other, and I opened my eyes, and she's got these huge blue eyes," Paltrow told Winfrey. "She was just staring at me with this unbelievable intensity. That's kind of what she's like. She's very curious." Although Apple is known to be her mom's mini-me, the blond also takes after her father.  Martin once   to sing an acoustic version of Ariana Grande's "Just A Little Bit Of Your Heart," and Apple crushed it. At the end of the song, she was met with a standing ovation and a kiss from her dad. In June 2022, she   before seeing her mini-me go off to college in the fall. â€œIt was horrible. It was truly horrifying,â€ Paltrow told   about her daughter leaving for school. â€œI was sick to my stomach, bursting into tears.â€ â€œShe came home for October break just last weekend, so that was amazing,â€ she added. â€œI see her, but not as much as Iâ€™d like. Iâ€™d like to see her every day, but Iâ€™m so happy for her. Sheâ€™s doing great.â€ In May, Paltrow  "I love you so deeply and wholly, it defies articulation. To behold you as a 19 year old woman fills my heart with almost unbearable love, pride and meaning! I canâ€™t take it!" she wrote in the caption. In 2006, Paltrow welcomed her son, Moses, with Martin. Like Apple, he also takes after his dad. When Moses  ," he told host Jimmy Fallon that he's "really into music." "I like to do it a lot,â€ Moses said. â€œRight now, Iâ€™d say Iâ€™m playing guitar the most. It used to be piano for a while, and then I started doing guitar lessons again.â€ When Paltrow  , she shared a few photos of him over the years. One of the snaps showed Moses jamming out behind the mic as his dad played on the keys.  In April, Paltrow gave her son a  t when he turned 17 years old. After 13 years of marriage, Paltrow and Martin announced in 2014 that  â€œ and get a divorce. The actor later found love again with producer Brad Falchuk, known for his collaborations with Ryan Murphy, including â€œAmerican Horror Storyâ€ and â€œPose.â€  Before the two wed, Apple and Martin met Falchukâ€™s children on the 2016 ski trip at the center of a lawsuit in which the actor was  and causing serious injury.  The two tied the knot in 2018 and Paltrow became a stepmother to Falchukâ€™s two children, whom he shares with his ex-wife Suzanne Bukinik, creating a blended family. In October 2020, Falchuk   of him going to vote and the same polling location his daughter was volunteering at. The â€œPoseâ€ creator said it was â€œpretty coolâ€ to see his little girl there. Over the years, Paltrow and Isabella have grown close. In September 2022, the "Iron Man" star celebrated her stepdaughter's 18th birthday. , Paltrow shared a photo of her and Isabella together on on her Instagram story for her stepdaughter's birthday. Over the snap, she wrote, "Happy birthday @izzyfalchuk. We miss you today and love you.â€ In August, Paltrow responded to fan questions on Instagram, including one that read: â€œDo you find it hard sometimes to be a bonus (step) mom?â€ Paltrow shared that she did find it â€œreally hardâ€ at first. â€œAll the existing media around what a stepmother is casts us in this evil, villainous light. Itâ€™s kind of like trying to avoid land mines,â€ Paltrow said in the video. â€œAnd then youâ€™re going into a family with dynamics, and thereâ€™s all kinds of fear around loss, and what does this new person mean.â€ But she said deciding to treat her children and stepchildren the same helped her reach the relationship they share today, which she described as â€œpretty great.â€ Falchuk shares Isabella and Brody with his ex-wife, Suzanne Bukinik. Paltrow has said that both of her children are similar in age to her stepchildren.  In March 2018, Falchuk shared a sweet snap with his son as they climbed a tree together. "More people have been on the summit of Mt. Everest than have climbed to the top of a giant redwood. This is us about a third of the way up â€œGrandfatherâ€. Brody was the youngest to ever do it," the proud dad captioned the post, adding the hashtag, #fathersandsons. After Falchuk and Paltrow got  , Paltrow said she was concerned at first about  .  "Itâ€™s funny because when I became a stepmother, when I knew I was going to become a stepmother, I was like, â€˜Sâ€”, I have no idea how to do this. Thereâ€™s nothing to read. What do I do? Where do I step in? Where do I not? Like, how do I do this?â€™" she told Gabrielle Union, who is  , on the "Goop" podcast in March 2021,  . But Paltrow said that she started to see things differently when she told herself: "F--- it, these are my kids. Iâ€™m not going to be scared to discipline them or draw the boundary." â€œThatâ€™s really what shifted everything," she told Falchuk in a September podcast episode. Falchuk also recalled a time when Paltrow got a little stern with Brody. He said the "Shallow Hal" star "yelled" at Brody when they were having dinner, leaving the teen "shocked." But Brody soon teen became "relaxed" because he was being treated like â€œevery other kid here," Falchuk said. â€œIf someone asked me for advice on it, I would just say, â€˜From day one, really treat them as your kid,'" Paltrow noted. title: SpaceXâ€™s Starship achieves liftoff and separation but â€˜mishapâ€™ results in loss of rocket
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands SpaceX launched the most powerful rocket ever developed â€” the companyâ€™s next-generation Starship â€” on a key test flight on Saturday that could pave the way for missions to the moon and eventually Mars. The uncrewed test flight was mostly successful with several key milestones achieved, but SpaceX ultimately lost contact with Starship roughly 10 minutes into flight, and the spacecraft likely self-detonated due to an issue mid-flight. In a statement, the Federal Aviation Administration said a â€œmishapâ€ occurred during the rocketâ€™s launch. â€œThe anomaly resulted in a loss of the vehicle.Â No injuries or public property damage have been reported,â€ the administration said. The FAA will investigate the mishap and ultimately determine if the rocketâ€™s return to flight would affect public safety. The nearly 400-foot-tall Starship rocket lifted off at 8 a.m. ET from SpaceXâ€™s Starbase test site in Boca Chica, Texas.Â  Cheers erupted from SpaceXâ€™s headquarters in Hawthorne, California, as the Starship rocket ignited and rumbled skyward. The fate of the Starship spacecraft is not yet known, butÂ  Â that SpaceX webcaster John Insprucker said during a livestream of the event that the spacecraftâ€™s automated flight termination system was likely triggered and the spacecraft appeared to have detonated. Itâ€™s not yet known what could have caused SpaceX to lose contact with Starship, but the spacecraftâ€™s flight termination system is designed to kick in if it veers off course or another major anomaly is detected. This was only the second launch of Starship, after a first test in April ended with the rocket exploding several minutes after liftoff. The rocket has two parts: a first-stage booster known as Super Heavy and an upper-stage Starship spacecraft. During Saturdayâ€™s launch, the two parts of the rocket separated in flight for the first time â€” a major milestone for SpaceX. The company pulled off a maneuver dubbed â€œhot staging,â€ which involved igniting the Starship spacecraftâ€™s engines while the Super Heavy booster was still partially firing. The hot-staging strategy is designed to use the spacecraftâ€™s engines to help it separate and continue on to orbit. After separation, the Super Heavy first-stage was meant to fall back to Earth and splash down in the Gulf of Mexico, but SpaceX reported that the booster exploded, possibly due to an anomaly. Few other details were provided at the time. Both the Super Heavy first-stage booster and the Starship spacecraft are designed to be reusable. The launch was a closely watched event, with high stakes for SpaceX as well as for the future of American space exploration.Â  Starship is expected to play a crucial part in NASAâ€™s efforts to return to the moon. The spacecraft was selected by the agency to carry astronauts to the lunar surface during the upcoming Artemis III mission, which could launch as early as 2025. SpaceX founder and CEO Elon Musk has also said that Starship was developed for future missions to Mars. The rocketâ€™s second outing followed what was a fiery and destructive debut earlier this year. In SpaceXâ€™s first attempt to launch Starship, the rocket exploded a few minutes after liftoff, destroying much of the infrastructure at the launch pad and causing damage to coastal wetlands and a nearby Texas state park. The incident triggered a monthslong safety review and drew intense scrutiny over the environmental consequences of launching rockets from Boca Chica. Earlier this week, the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration cleared SpaceX to proceed with Starshipâ€™s second launch, saying that the company has conformed to the environmental protection requirements for such operations. title: Taylor Swift postpones Brazil show due to â€˜extreme temperaturesâ€™
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands Taylor Swiftâ€™s concert Nov. 18 in Rio de Janeiro has been postponed due to â€œextreme temperatures.â€ Swift announced the decision via a statement on her Instagram story before the show Saturday night.  â€œIâ€™m writing this from my dressing room in the stadium. The decision has been made to postpone tonightâ€™s show due to the extreme temperatures in Rio,â€ the statement read. â€œThe safety and well-being of my fans, fellow performers, and crew has to and always will come first.â€ The show has been rescheduled for Monday, Nov. 20, according to an   from Time For Fun, the entertainment company for the "Eras Tour" stops in Brazil.  All tickets originally purchased for Saturday's show will be valid for Monday's performance, the post added.  The decision comes   in Rio de Janeiro. Swift mourned the loss of her fan via an earlier statement on her Instagram story. â€œI canâ€™t even tell you how devastated I am by this,â€ she wrote in part. â€œThereâ€™s very little information I have other than the fact that she was so incredibly beautiful and far too young.â€ Swift said that she felt â€œoverwhelmed by griefâ€ every time she tried to talk about it and would not be addressing her fanâ€™s death on stage. She added, â€œI want to say now I feel this loss deeply and my broken heart goes out to her family and friends. This is the last thing I ever thought would happen when we decided to bring this tour to Brazil.â€ The fan was later identified as Ana Clara Benevides Machado by the event organizer, Time4Fun.Â  â€œLast night, Ana Clara felt unwell and was promptly attended to by the team of firefighters and paramedics, being taken to the medical center at the Nilton Santos Stadium for first aid protocol,â€ the organizer told NBC News in a statement. â€œGiven the situation, the medical team chose to transfer her to Salgado Filho Hospital, where, after almost an hour of emergency care, she unfortunately died.â€ According to  , she remains set to perform in Rio de Janeiro on Sunday, Nov. 19. This is the second concert Swift has had to postpone on the South American leg of her â€œEras Tour.â€ The â€œKarmaâ€ singer's Nov. 10 concert in Buenos Aires, Argentina was postponed to Nov. 12 due to weather.  Swift announced the news   at the time, writing in part, â€œI love a rain show but Iâ€™m never going to endanger my fans or my fellow performers and crew.â€  â€œWeâ€™ve rescheduled tonightâ€™s Buenos Aires show for Sunday due to the weather being so truly chaotic it would be unsafe to try and put on this concert,â€ she added. Francesca Gariano is a New York City-based freelance journalist reporting on culture, entertainment, beauty, lifestyle and wellness. She is a freelance contributor to TODAY.com,Â where she covers pop culture and breaking news. Â©Â 2023 NBC UNIVERSAL

title: Georgia murder suspect captured after monthlong manhunt
content: Sections Shows More Follow today More Brands After more than a month on the run, a murder suspect who wasÂ  Â from a Macon, Georgia, jail has been recaptured following a multiweek manhunt. Joey Travis Fournier, 52, was apprehended Saturday around noon near Stockbridge, Georgia, according to the Bibb County Sheriffâ€™s Office. Fournier was being held in the Bibb County detention center on a murder charge, police said. Fournier had been on the run since Oct. 16, when he escaped from Bibb County Jail along with three other men, Marc Kerry Anderson, Johnifer Dernard Barnwell and Chavis Demaryo Stokes. The inmates made their way out of the detention center through a damaged window and a cut fence, the Bibb County Sheriffâ€™s Office said in a statement at the time of the escape. â€œWe are grateful that this last escapee has been captured,â€ Bibb County Sheriff David Davis said. â€œMy heartfelt appreciation goes out to all of the hard working law enforcement officers from the Bibb County Sheriffâ€™s Office and from all of our partner agencies who worked tirelessly to bring these four fugitives back into custody.â€ Police said Fournier will be returned to Bibb County Law Enforcement Center later today. Stokes was the first to be apprehended on Oct. 26 in Montezuma. Then Anderson was found in Atlanta on Nov. 3. On Nov. 12, Barnwell was apprehended in Augusta. Â©Â 2023 NBC UNIVERSAL
